alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Concordia; Franklin; Madison; Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 25 at 10:08AM CDT until August 27 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Louisiana and Mississippi, including the following areas and parishes, in northeast Louisiana, Catahoula, Concordia, Franklin LA, Madison LA and Tensas. In Mississippi, Adams, Claiborne, Clarke, Copiah, Covington, Forrest, Franklin MS, Hinds, Jasper, Jefferson, Jefferson Davis, Jones, Kemper, Lamar, Lauderdale, Lawrence, Leake, Lincoln, Madison MS, Marion, Neshoba, Newton, Rankin, Scott, Simpson, Smith, Warren and Yazoo. * WHEN...Until 7 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms capable of producing heavy rain will develop and move across the Watch area today. Additional rainfall on already saturated ground will quickly run off and could lead to additional flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
